class_notes:
(Same as AAS 378 1)
Title: Black Cultural Movements: New Negro Renaissance & Black Arts Movement


This course examines 2 of the most significant African American cultural movements of the 20th century?the New Negro Renaissance (aka the Harlem Renaissance, c. 1912-1932) and the Black Arts Movement (c. 1965-1979). While placing a primary emphasis on literary arts and authors, we will approach both movements as complex interdisciplinary, multi-generic phenomena concerned with Black freedom struggles. As we ?map? the histories of these two major movements, we will consider the ways artists and critics alike have constructed these movements, the relationships of these movements to each other and to Black Studies, and the processes and politics that shape notions of literary history, race, gender, sexuality, and culture in American society.
course_description: Literary topics vary. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
